title: [K-12] Cognitive Load Theory-Based Language Learning Environment Design

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic language structures and experience with digital devices
context.additional_context: Application of cognitive load minimization strategies for beginner learners aiming to enter medical/legal/technical fields when acquiring language in BYOD environments.

learning_goals: Learners apply three or more cognitive load reduction techniques (e.g., chunking, visual cue utilization) to actual language learning scenarios
Learners design efficient information processing strategies between working memory and long-term memory with over 80% accuracy in technology-based environments
Learners create personalized learning pathways that reduce unnecessary cognitive load by over 50% during specific language tasks
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
